meanings.sent1: The spectre of a lost soul wandered the halls at night.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was said to be visited by a spectre every midnight.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled nervously, pretending to be chased by a friendly spectre.
meanings.sent4: The misty spectre floated through the graveyard, its presence sending shivers down spines.
meanings.sent5: The pale spectre glowed eerily in the moonlight, a chilling sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A haunting or disturbing image or thought.
meanings.sent1: The spectre of poverty loomed over the struggling family.
meanings.sent2: The spectre of failure haunted his every decision.
meanings.sent3: The spectre of a bad haircut made her laugh uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The spectre of war cast a dark shadow over the peaceful village.
meanings.sent5: The spectre of loneliness whispered in her ear, filling her heart with sadness.

meanings.definition: A source of terror or dread.
meanings.sent1: The spectre of the unknown filled him with fear.
meanings.sent2: The looming spectre of the final exam kept her up at night.
meanings.sent3: The spectre of a spider sent him running out of the room.
meanings.sent4: The spectre of public speaking made her palms sweat and her heart race.
meanings.sent5: The spectre of rejection haunted his dreams, making him doubt himself.
